item.title: Use C++ to Blink an LED on a Raspberry Pi in Under 5 Minutes!
item.description:
Dave shows you how to blink an LED connected to a GPIO pin of a standard Raspberry Pi 4. For my book on the autism spectrum, check out: https://amzn.to/3zBinWM
For full details on wiringPi, which is needed to run this example, see their github: https://github.com/WiringPi/WiringPi
Basic steps to install it: git clone https://github.com/WiringPi/WiringPi.git cd WiringPi ./build debian cd debian-template sudo apt install wiringpifilewith.deb [Filename varies, subst your .deb file]
Dave's Attic - Friday 4PM Podcast - https://www.youtube.com/@UCtb6a_CnmGbSns9G8W2Ny0w
Follow me for updates! Twitter: @davepl1968 davepl1968 Facebook: fb.com/davepl
item.author: (Dave's Garage)

item.title: The Stallman report
item.description: October 14th, 2024 Richard Stallman (aka “RMS”) is the founder of GNU and the Free Software Foundation and present-day voting member of the Free Software Foundation (FSF) board of directors and “Chief GNUisance” of the GNU project. He is responsible for innumerable contributions to the free software movement, setting its guiding principles, organizing political action, and directly contributing to a flourishing free software ecosystem. The majority of Stallman’s political activity has been of priceless value to society at large.

item.title: Mono vs Micro Repos
item.description: Back from #manflu! Today's edition of #tech on ice we talk about #monorepos and how folks immediately think they are bad. I don't think that is quite the case. Let's talk about why monorepos can be fine and how microrepos can be bad. #developer #programming #microservices #coldplunge
item.author: (Isaac Levin)

item.title: High Performance Postgres with Rust, Cloudflare & Hyperdrive
item.description:
Hello developers and architects, I'm James!
In this video, you'll explore how to efficiently connect Cloudflare Workers to external relational databases. Learn about Cloudflare's Hyperdrive service to enhance performance and reduce load.
You'll connect a Rust application to a Postgres database using Hyperdrive. Discover the ins and outs of setting up a secure and performant system while tackling the unique challenges of Cloudflare's global footprint and the scaling behaviour of serverless functions.
00:00 - Introduction and Overview 00:27 - Challenges of Connecting to External Databases 01:06 - Introducing Cloudflare Hyperdrive 01:24 - Setting Up Database Connections in Rust 03:21 - Direct Connection to Postgres Database 05:57 - Enhancing Performance with Hyperdrive 09:23 - Local Development and Testing 11:09 - Performance Testing and Results 13:23 - Troubleshooting and Best Practices 15:44 - Conclusion and Next Steps
Links GitHub Repo - https://github.com/jeastham1993/serverless-cloudflare Exograph Article - https://exograph.dev/blog/wasm-pg-explorations-2#hyperdrive-with-the-extended-query-protocol Hyperdrive - https://developers.cloudflare.com/hyperdrive/ Neon Serverless Postgres - https://neon.tech/ Workers RS - https://github.com/cloudflare/workers-rs Twitter - https://twitter.com/plantpowerjames LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/james-eastham Website - https://jameseastham.co.uk
item.author: (James Eastham)

item.title: Perform custom validation in Blazor | BinaryIntellect Knowledge Base
item.description: Validating form data is one of the most common task in any web application. ASP.NET Core offers a set of validation attributes for performing model level data validations. Blazor apps can also make use of the same validation attributes. Some of the validation attributes include [Required], [StringLength], [Range], and [Compare]. At times you want to perform some validation not covered by these attributes. This is when you want to create a custom validation attribute. In this article we will discuss how that can be done.
item.author: (Bipin Joshi)

item.title: Error Monitoring in .NET MAUI with Sentry
item.description:
In this video, you'll learn how to use Sentry to monitor and manage errors in your .NET MAUI applications. If you want to ensure your applications run smoothly and detect problems before they affect your users, this video is for you!
